intro: Cryptocarya kaengkrachanensis, commonly known as the Kaeng Krachan cryptocarya, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to Thailand. It belongs to the Lauraceae family, which includes laurels, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and smooth, greyish bark. The plant typically grows in lowland and hill forest areas, often in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a distinctive aromatic scent when crushed. The flowers are small, greenish-white, and clustered in panicles, while the fruit is a small, dark purple drupe.
